title: Ukraine crisis: 'We don't have the option to leave'
description: Britons in Ukraine are weighing up whether they can escape as fears of a Russian invasion mount.

title: Can England's greatest showmen 'light up' Rome to reignite Six Nations hopes?
description: England head coach Eddie Jones trusts his "emotionally connected" younger players to "light up" Rome on Sunday when they face Italy in the Six Nations.

title: Maternity leave: Working mums return to office after two weeks
description: Returning to work two weeks after giving birth was the right decision, two mothers say.

title: Russia-Ukraine crisis: UK won’t be able to fly people out - minister
description: Russia is ready to attack at "no notice", says James Heappey, as British citizens are urged to leave now.

title: M4 crash: Second child dies after Newport collision
description: The three-year-old boy had been in hospital following the crash which claimed the life of a girl.

title: Decision on Valieva doping case due on Monday
description: A decision on Russian teenage figure skater Kamila Valieva's doping case will be made on Monday following a hearing on Sunday.

title: Covid protests: Hundreds fined as convoy heads to Paris
description: Thousands of demonstrators opposed to France's coronavirus regulations are trying to enter the city.

title: Ukraine tensions: Russia invasion could begin any day, US warns
description: President Biden and Vladimir Putin to talk as the US says Russia could invade Ukraine "at any time".

title: Blind commuter harassed on escalator because of guide dog
description: Dr Amit Patel has shared the footage of the altercation on a London Underground escalator.

title: Brexit: NI Protocol issues 'unlikely to be resolved before election'
description: DUP leader Sir Jeffrey Donaldson says the government has "dishonoured" the New Decade New Approach deal.

title: Chidiebere Ibe: Illustrator of black fetus to have art published in book
description: Nigerian illustrator Chidibere Ibe's medical illustrations aim to improve black skin representation in medical literature.

title: Australia batter Pucovski suffers 11th concussion in comeback match
description: Australia batter Will Pucovski is experiencing concussion symptoms for the 11th time after being substituted out of his comeback match for Victoria.

title: Covid: Police send PM questionnaire, and court orders end to trucker blockade
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Saturday morning.

title: Jordan Nash: John Lewis Christmas ad child star on mental health struggles
description: For Children's Mental Health Week, child actor Jordan Nash talks to pupils about his mental health.

title: Preview & key stats: Wales v Scotland - watch live on BBC One from 14:15
description: Team news, match preview and statistics for Saturday's match between Wales and Scotland at the Principality Stadium.

title: Friendship helped us through loss in the pandemic
description: Former school friends rediscover the joy of the arts in a project in memory of a late friend.

title: The Papers: 'Get out' of Ukraine as Russia 'to invade any day'
description: Britons being warned to leave Ukraine amid concerns of a Russian attack dominate Saturday's papers.

title: Call 999 with early heart attack symptoms, NHS says
description: Thousands more lives could be saved by paying attention to early symptoms of heart attacks, doctors say.

title: Winter Olympics: Lindsey Jacobellis & Nick Baumgartner win gold in thrilling mixed snowboard cross final
description: Watch highlights as USA's Lindsey Jacobellis and Nick Baumgartner - with a combined age of 76 - win the inaugural snowboard cross mixed team title at the 2022 Winter Olympics.

title: 'My prosthetic ears make me feel more normal'
description: After ground-breaking surgery 20 years ago, Janet Craven says the results have been life-changing.

title: WSL highlights: Chelsea 0-0 Arsenal
description: Watch highlights as Arsenal maintain their two-point advantage over Chelsea at the top of the Women's Super League table after a dramatic draw at Kingsmeadow that somehow ends goalless.

title: Jonny Pelham: The comedian telling jokes about his childhood sexual abuse
description: Jonny Pelham's stand-up is helping him and other victims to heal. But not everyone sees it that way.

title: Boris Johnson sent Downing Street lockdown party questionnaire by police
description: No 10 confirms that Boris Johnson has been contacted and says he will "respond as required".

title: Chagos islanders in emotional, historic trip home
description: Andrew Harding boards a boat of Chagossians returning to the island the UK refuses to return to Mauritius.

title: Ukraine's Great Famine memories fuel resentment of Kremlin
description: The Holodomor in the 1930s is central to Ukraine's idea of a nation that defies Russian domination.

title: Is Trudeau losing his fight against truckers?
description: Anti-vaccine mandate protests are in their third week and Mr Trudeau is under pressure to stop them.

title: Greenham Common: The women who fought to ban the bomb
description: The Greenham Common anti-nuclear protest was the UK's biggest women-led movement since the Suffragettes.

title: The hidden side of Ethiopia's brutal civil war
description: The BBC gains rare access to the country, hearing from civilians caught in the crossfire.

title: How Ouka the dog started flying on a paraglider
description: Ouka the dog and his owner Shams can be seen flying in the French Alps.

title: Egypt prisoners tortured to give up names, says ex-detainee
description: Fear of arrest is more widespread than ever, a leading activist freed from jail tells the BBC.

title: Paris attacks trial: 'How I persuaded Salah Abdeslam to open up'
description: The lawyer who cross-examined Salah Abdeslam explains how she avoided confrontation with him.

title: Week in pictures: 5 - 11 February 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken this week.

title: Nato and its role in the Ukraine crisis
description: The role of Nato is crucial in our understanding of Russia's troop build-up and the West's reaction to it.
